decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between the "Amulet of Vigor" card and the "Primeval Titan" card to generate large amounts of mana quickly. By using cards like "Azusa, Lost but Seeking" and "Sakura-Tribe Elder" to ramp up, the deck aims to get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield as soon as possible to search for powerful lands like "Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion" and "Slayers' Stronghold" to give it additional abilities and win the game with a powerful attack. The deck also includes utility cards like "Reclamation Sage" and "Engineered Explosives" to deal with opposing threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the board state while digging for key cards with card draw and filtering effects. By leveraging powerful planeswalkers and win conditions like Celestial Colonnade, the deck seeks to establish a dominant position over the opponent and ultimately win the game through attrition and control of the battlefield.

This deck utilizes the Hardened Scales enchantment to maximize the +1/+1 counter synergy with creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker. By quickly ramping up counters with Steel Overseer and Walking Ballista, the deck can overwhelm opponents with large, powerful creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Throne of Geth and Animation Module allows for additional ways to manipulate counters and generate value. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early and maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures and building a board presence to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp into powerful threats like Knight of the Reliquary and Devoted Druid. The deck also includes cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to tutor for key pieces and refill the board. By efficiently deploying creatures and utilizing synergy between cards like Vizier of Remedies and Devoted Druid, the deck aims to execute a fast and aggressive game plan to outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to increase the power of +1/+1 counters on creatures. Cards like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Walking Ballista work well in conjunction with Hardened Scales to quickly build up a threatening board presence. The deck aims to play aggressively and overwhelm the opponent with large, buffed-up creatures. Welding Jar and Throne of Geth provide additional utility and support to the strategy, while cards like Ancient Stirrings help to dig for key pieces. The deck excels at quickly building up a formidable army and applying pressure to the opponent.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to enable powerful early plays such as Hollow One and Flameblade Adept. It also utilizes cards like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix to maintain pressure on the opponent. Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler provide additional threats, while Collective Brutality offers disruption and reach. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, leveraging the graveyard as a resource to maximize efficiency and tempo.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana. This allows the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul, as well as huge threats like Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes removal and card draw options to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while disrupting their plans with control elements.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of efficient burn spells, powerful creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, and disruptive cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel. By consistently applying pressure and preventing the opponent from stabilizing, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can enact their game plan. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to different colors of mana for casting spells.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful and dangerous threat on the battlefield. By using cards like Street Wraith, Thoughtseize, and Fetch Lands, you can lower your life total while also disrupting your opponent's strategy. Once Death's Shadow is large enough, you can finish off your opponent with powerful spells like Temur Battle Rage and Ghor-Clan Rampager. The deck also features versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key cards like Life from the Loam, Stinkweed Imp, and Golgari Thug. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the player can dredge through the deck to bring back strong creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. Combining these creatures with Conflagrate for direct damage allows for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent. The deck aims to create a powerful board presence while utilizing the graveyard as a resource to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to use cards like Faithless Looting, Goblin Lore, and Burning Inquiry to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards such as Hollow One, Bloodghast, and Flamewake Phoenix. This helps to bring powerful creatures onto the battlefield for a quick aggressive playstyle, with cards like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality providing additional removal and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with hard-hitting creatures and burn spells, making it a fast-paced and explosive aggro deck.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. It includes a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a combination of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's multiple colors. The deck aims to be proactive and disruptive, combining speed and power to dominate the opponent.

This deck aims to aggressively control the board while maintaining hand advantage and steadily applying pressure on the opponent. It achieves this by utilizing a versatile mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and resilient threats. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to efficiently generate card advantage through spells like Faithless Looting, Lingering Souls, and Bedlam Reveler. It also has the flexibility to switch between aggressive and controlling strategies depending on the matchup. The deck's color combination of white, red, and black allows for a wide range of powerful spells that can handle various threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to gain card advantage. The deck utilizes powerful control spells such as Cryptic Command and Path to Exile to keep the opponent's board clear, while using planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes search cards like Opt and Search for Azcanta to find key cards and maintain a steady stream of resources.

This deck focuses on utilizing spirits with aggressive abilities to maintain control over the battlefield. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Drogskol Captain to hinder opponents' strategies and protect your own creatures, combined with powerful attackers like Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield and disruptive spells like Path to Exile, this deck can quickly establish a dominant board presence and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing spirit creatures with a low mana cost to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spell Queller with powerful spirits like Geist of Saint Traft and Drogskol Captain. Aether Vial helps to efficiently get creatures onto the battlefield, while creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Supreme Phantom provide additional support and buffs for the spirit tribe. The deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while also disrupting the opponent's game plan.
